channel.title: prototyping on Joost Plattel
channel.description: Recent content in prototyping on Joost Plattel

item.title: Opal
item.description: For Opal I’ve worked on hardware prototypes under NDA. I’ve been exploring different protocols and low level unix interfaces.

item.title: SOVN
item.description: Sovn (previously known as Jawsaver) creates smart earbuds to stop teeth grinding & clenching. Bruxism is a problem and to solve that I was asked to create several prototypes of mechanics to see what’s the most interesting strategy to develop into a product. All prototypes where supported with a dynamic earbud platform that let’s a user test different mechanics. Arduino’s, micropython, 3D printing and rapid prototyping are things that we’re used in this development proces.

item.title: Wearable keyboard prototypes
item.description: As I’ve highlighted in previous posts, a wearable keyboard is one of my main projects this month. In this post I want to show you some pictures of the first prototypes and tell you a bit more about the proces of designing a keyboard. Remember I’ve got really no experience on ergonomics or knowledge about user-interface, I mostly go by feel here as it’s a highly personalized product (for now!).
